i just wanna be able to do things the way i do in debian...i'm trying gentoo in a VMWare virtual box and it's very up-to-date but it isn't very concise and it's _strange_ ...specially when you're accustomed to doing things the debian way for years
yeah, I like the 'debian' way....it's way easier, especially when you finally learn it :)
i could easily use gentoo, but i don't know the way of doing things in that 'gentoo way'
i couldn't handle it very well, i tried doing things manually and my changes got overriden by portage updates and things :'(
ubuntu is totally debian underneath the desktop
example, for adding a thing to your runlevel you use something like rc-update add <program> default..shitty
i prefer the rcX.d and init.d approach....MUCH better
in debian i just create a new program in init.d and link it using the [SK] nnPROGRAM link way...easy!
using update-rc.d is even easier, saves a lot of typing :)
